name: Apgar Visitor Center
description: Apgar Visitor Center is located 2 miles east of the West Glacier entrance to the park. Rangers are on duty to assist with trip planning. The visitor center is the hub for the Going-to-the-Sun Road shuttle system on the west side of the park.

images.title: A ranger helps visitors in the Apgar Visitor Center.
images.altText: A park ranger, standing behind an information desk, assists a group of visitors.
images.caption: A ranger helps visitors in the Apgar Visitor Center.

images.title: Outside the Apgar Visitor Center
images.altText: Visitors milgle outside the Apgar Visitor Center on the west side of Glacier National Park.
images.caption: Visitors milgle outside the Apgar Visitor Center on the west side of Glacier National Park.

operatingHours.description: The Apgar Visitor Center is open seven days a week in the summer. In the winters the Apgar Visitor Center is sometimes open on weekends.
operatingHours.name: Apgar Visitor Center

emailAddresses.description: This is the general park contact email.

name: Logan Pass Visitor Center
description: The Logan Pass Visitor Center sits atop the Continental Divide at 6,646 feet. The visitor center houses exhibits on the plants and animals found in the sub-alpine region of the park. Numerous exhibits outside the visitor center tell the story of geology, climate change, and life in the harsh alpine world above treeline. Logan Pass is perhaps the most crowded location in the park with the parking lot filling to capacity early in the morning. Plan to arrive early or visit later in the afternoon.

images.title: Logan Pass Visitor Center
images.altText: A view of Logan Pass Visitor Center with Mt. Reynolds in the background and vegetation in front.
images.caption: The bold angles and bright colors of the Logan Pass Visitor Center are typical of Mission 66 architecture throughout the National Park Service.

operatingHours.description: The Logan Pass Visitor Center typically opens in late June to early July.
operatingHours.name: Logan Pass Visitor Center

name: St. Mary Visitor Center
description: The St. Mary Visitor Center is located just inside the east entrance of the park near the community of St. Mary, Montana. Rangers are on duty inside to assist with trip planning. A park film is shown throughout the day. Exhibits highlight the rich Native American history associated with Glacier National Park.

images.title: St. Mary Visitor Center in the Summer
images.altText: The pointed roof of the St. Mary Visitor center juts into the sky on a sunny summer day. People stan
images.caption: The pointed roof of the St. Mary Visitor center juts into the sky on a sunny summer day. People stand outside and a large van is parked in front.

images.title: St. Mary EV Charger
images.altText: an electric car charging in a parking lot
images.caption: Because fossil fuels are harmful to people and warming the climate, Glacier National Park has an electric vehicle charger in the St. Mary Visitor Center parking lot.

operatingHours.description: The St. Mary Visitor Center is open during the summer season seven days a week during normal business hours.
operatingHours.name: St. Mary Visitor Center

emailAddresses.description: This is the park's general contact email, there is no direct email for Glacier's visitor centers.
